Reviews.Title: “No service!”
Reviews.Author: Sims3
Reviews.Content: Showed up early and the door was locked. There was a sign that said ring the bell. I did that several times and got no response... I then walked around the building to see if there was another door. No such luck. Since I was earlier than 3pm I went to the beach for a fewhours then came back after 3pm. After 3pm I had the same response... meaning no response. So I went looking for another room. Even had a woman at the front desk of another hotel call Hotel Iberia and there was NO ANSWER. After several attemps, I did end up with a room at the Coral Princess Hotel. Much nicer and a bit more expensive but at least they let me in the door. I am still waiting to see if Hotel Iberia tries to charge me for a room I had no access too...

Reviews.Title: “2 star room, 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and genuine and took a lot of time to explain the area, things to do, how to get around, and even some history. Everyone working there seemed to enjoy their job and I felt safe and at home. The reception was available all night, just in case anything happened. The staff clearly put effort into making the rooms comfortable - the room smelled very clean upon arrival, the air conditioning had been turned on to cool the room down, towels were replaced and beds were made each day, and they even folded some of our laundry. Unfortunately this did not make up for the poor physical condition of the room. The tiles were stained, the mirror was corroded, and most annoyingly the water took 10-15 minutes to get "hot". Location was mediocre - there was a nice plaza/beach within walking distance, and a supermarket across the street, but you still have to drive to Old San Juan. This hotel was very reminiscent of the guest houses you will find in SE Asia for $10-15 per night; unfortunately the cost here is >$100 per night so the quality is a little disappointing. That said, it was still $40 cheaper than anything else in San Juan at the time of booking so I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShiningHalo
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at Hotel Iberia again. The first reason why is the staff. From the moment we walked in the door, they were nothing but helpful and friendly. They were informative, offered suggestions on where to go, where to eat, etc etc. The second reason is the charm of the hotel. The lobby is just...cute. And the rest of the hotel definitely has charm. It's an old building; don't expect anything modern. But the AC in our room worked great, and we had a nice flat screen TV mounted on the wall. The room was a little sparse, but had everything we needed. Hotel was pretty easy to find (with directions) and a nice location. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot if you don't spend a lot of time at your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CoconutWireVI
Reviews.Content: We used this as "base camp" for our explorations of PR. It was great! The staff are very nice and the location is within walking distance of Ashford Ave (food, night life, people watching, the Hagen Daz store, shopping, etc). They also have parking for rental cars and a grocery store next door. The rooms were as to be expected, but very clean. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, so-so lodging”
Reviews.Author: DCMPuraVida
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here three nights. Christopher and the rest of the staff were wonderful. Christopher went beyond the call of duty by going to the beach to recover my lost cell phone from the police. It was waiting for us at the front desk when we returned -- before we even realized it was missing. He has was full of advice on where to go and how to get around. The room was small and a little noisy from traffic and people in the hallway. The AC worked great but it was too loud to try run while sleeping. The bathroom fan was very loud too. The mattress seemed a little broken down. As other reviews have indicated, the roof top terrace is nice but it seems like they are not taking advantage of its potential as a place for guests to have breakfast or drinks. Also agree with others that the hotel's location makes it a little isolated from where the action is at the beach and dining spots --two long blocks to the north. If I was returning to Condado I would likely upgrade to one of the small inns closer to the water.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Noturavg
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a hotel oozing with mediocrity, I want the staff to be rude, so I don't feel so guilty criticizing the place. Unfortunately this was not the case at Hotel Iberia. The staff was exceptionally nice. The owner Christopher was a complete gentleman. He was kind, helpful, and spent a significant amount of time giving me directions to get around and helping me plan my itinerary. I really liked the location as well. It was surrounded by nice houses in Condado, and not a terribly far walk to the beach (roughly 10 minutes). The 24hr grocery store next door was nice too. Also we left something in the hotel and the staff called me and left me a message as soon as it was discovered. Unfortunately, the hotel was a very budget hotel for not a very budget price. If I were paying half the price, I would not mind the old outdated furniture, the dankness, and the cheap linens. However, at over $120 for a double for a US hotel, you except at least a little quality. I know Condado is not cheap, and I know $100 isn't tons of money for a hotel, but there are a few basics that should be provided. We never had hot water during the stay, the water pressure was horrible, and it would take 45 minutes for the toilet tank to get refilled before you could flush again. Again, not stuff I would mind if I was staying in a hostel or paying budget prices. I wouldn't stay here again if there were other options for the same price, but if all the other viable options were over $200 (like it was the weekend I was there), then I'd maybe consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make this hotel 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Irongut99
Reviews.Content: First impression I was a little concerned...The staff put me at ease right away, they go way above the top to help with whatever you need, for example I forgot the charger for my cellphone, without hesitation I was handed his charger "use it as long as you need" with directions to the local radioshack. Sure as other reviews go over it's not the Ritz, I don't like staying at the Ritz...The room is clean, it's in a nice location, close to great restaurants. We stayed one night pre-cruise. Felt I made a good choice. Don't forget to take advantage of the rooftop sitting area, great views. We went next door to the grocery store, had a great hot food tak-out service plus a couple of cold ones the rooftop was a great place to head back too for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Inn in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SDB_SI
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Puerto Rico where one of the places I stayed at was Hotel Iberia in San Juan. I was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations. The house was quaint, clean and modest. It provided the basic necessities for a comfortable stay at an economical price. The owner is a plethora of information, history and goes out of his way to ensure that you are aware of the great restaurants and services in the area, and that you have detailed directions to get to where you need to go. There is parking out front, supermarket within walking distance, and you're a short drive from other stores and restaurants. It is also conveniently located off the highway. This said, I must also mention that the location is on the borderline of the nicer tourist area -- I wouldn't walk around there by myself at night. All in all, I was pleased with my stay there and the value for traveling on a budget -- I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean for the price”
Reviews.Author: Arlene V
Reviews.Content: Im a bussiness woman from the southwest of the Island and everytime I have to go to San Juan I dont change my Hotel Iberia. I feel like Im going to my second house. The Owner always is very kind and I have been in almost all the rooms there and never had a problem. I was there in january and Im surprise about some reviews here because I have never found my room dirty. Always very clean and the staff is great and always treat me like Im part of the hotel. There is nothing fancy but the most important things are the clean rooms and how I feel there. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate.”
Reviews.Author: 12roon
Reviews.Content: This definitely is not your Ritz. But its the best you can get in under 100 bucks. The rooms are small and they do a really good job of promptly cleaning up every day. The shower was really tiny but u get hot water. I traveled alone at that time. This actually worked out great. Its extremely cheap ($80 -$90) and safe. There is some parking spots right outside the hotel. Great location. Its very close to all the great restaurants, 24hr supermarket, laundry etc.. The staff is super friendly. The guy who runs the place is awesome. He is very generous with his advice and helpful hints. You are not going to find a better place at this location for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap option”
Reviews.Author: dusty_travelers
Reviews.Content: The good things about this lil place were: - the owner, Christopher, who is hospitable and helpful, and - the proximity to the 24 hr supermarket. The room itself was average and good for crashing in at nite. But not the kind u wld want to spend an extra minute in. The worse part of my stay was the bathroom, which was not only dingy and tiny, but also had a slow shower. Though its not that far from Old San Juan, where we spent most of our time, the cost of commuting every night did add up pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “An average and cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yujiang
Reviews.Content: It is close to a beach, but the beach is not facilitated, and dirty. There is a big supermarket nearby and you can have cheap breakfast there. The room is big, but the facility is a little old and dirty. And the towel is not clean. In our room the the hot water and cold water for shower is switched, which make a little inconvenience. There is no elevator, so we have to move the luggage to the third floor by ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very very average”
Reviews.Author: Svenara
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel because it was the cheapest available for the dates I was travelling. Though the owner Christopher went out of the way to be helpful, the place itself is run down and cries for some help. The sheets were washed but had stains all over them (some had red stains aggg). The bathroom was dirty and looked bad. The shower had no force due to which taking a bath was a pain here. I bought my own shampoo etc as the only thing that was provided was the soap. The water jug smelled of strong chlorine and I preferred to buy water bottles. The glasses were of plastic and again did not make me want to drink out of it! The few advantages if I can mention however were, its right next to the supermarket where you can pretty much buy anything you want 9medicines, food, alcohol etc etc). Its about 8 minutes walk to the Condado beach and some nice resturants etc. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place rude staff and a complete scam!”
Reviews.Author: Yuchana
Reviews.Content: Charged me and my family $135 a night for a place with stained sheets disgusting bathroom with soap scum. No elevator to accomadate someone traveling with a small child and most of all no sense of customer service. My flight arrrived at 2am and the front desk agent had a nerve to tell me he was waiting and that the front desk closes at 12 amd that we made him wait. Last time I checked a person should always be available regardless of the time.From the looks of it I don't think they have "house keeping" because there is crap underneath the bed from a previous occupant. Completely disgusting dont waste your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no mean luxurious but neither does it pretend to be. It is in a great location a 3 minute walk from the bus stop into the old town, a 3 minute walk from bars and restaurants and 7 minutes to the beach. There is free parking at the hotel should you rent a car (which you should). There is a 24 hour supermarket right next to the hotel. The owner and all his staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and will give you travel tips and help you book anything over the phone. The room was always kept clean, and the towels were replaced frequently. Again not anything luxurious, but it is an inexpensive hotel with a lovely atmosphere and great location for San Juan and Puerto Rico as a whole. There was an airconditioning unit in the room (a bit nosy at night- but hey it keeps you cool so who is complaining!) and a flat screened tv with cable. A great terrace on the roof for eating dinner on or just reading a book. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to enjoy Puerto Rico. The staff that hotel were 10 times more helpful than the actual Tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: IdrivealotMaine
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending a couple of nights at the Hotel Iberia, Condado, San Juan, PR. I must say that it was wonderful. This is a small hotel and nothing like the mass produced, cookie cutter hotels springing up everywhere. This hotel has character and personality. There is a fine supermarket just a stone's throw away complete with deli where you can buy the same local style food as is served at a restaurant, but for about a third of the price. A few minutes walk to a beautiful beach. Same to the AMA (bus stop - Parada) for a .75 cent bus ride to Old San Juan and El Morro. The location of the Hotel Iberia is ideal. Listen to the owner for travel advice. He knows the island and was instrumental in making my vacation a success. I will stay here again. Matter of fact, I plan to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Jomerso
Reviews.Content: Last month I went to Puerto Rico in one of those desperate trip with any plans at all... At soon I got to the airport and I found this local tourist magazine that recommended the hotel Iberia. A very comfortable, with reasonable prices and clean hotel. I will suggest to ask for the rooms before because not all of them are the same. The Hotel its located close to the beach, old San Juan and main shopping areas. I was very satisfied of the treatment of the person in charge. Now I have a good choice for my next visit to the Island.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TomaszKa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has atmosphere - I was very happy with my choice. The location is just one block from the beach, there is a supermarket at the corner, many shopping and dining choices, bus stops (you can get to Old San Juan and other places), car rentals, etc. The room was nice and always clean. Excellent service - Crisobal, the owner and manager, is a great person, always helpful, friendly and kind. He is not only a source of many useful tips but also knows a lot about the island, the people, Puertorican culture and history. If you are looking for something more than just a room Hotel Iberia would be my choice:) To sum up - I went to Puerto RIco off season and really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Paul194789
Reviews.Content: Very good location specially if you come to San Juan to do business. Close to restaurants and easy acces to highway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: afiadl
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent small hotel for business travelers. Was received by the owner and assistant very cordial. Was instructed on places to eat, rooms are very clean, with new air conditioners, LCD television, cable TV, free internet, beach close by. Tour of the city was arranged, as well as the rain forest Taxis available within five minutes. Wil plan to stay on my next trips to the island, and will suggest to my business partners.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Location”
Reviews.Author: PatronGreensboro_SC
Reviews.Content: The owner was very friendly and willing to help with all our needs. There is a good supermarket and many restaurants close by. Easy access to beach

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the time being and use of it”
Reviews.Author: Jaydoc22
Reviews.Content: The place is small and rather interesting while staying there it feels as thou its not an actual "hotel" lol, HOWEVER, there's a grocery store a block away, the beach is only 2~3 blocks away and the strip was but a walk away.. No parking for the rental car since the event we went for was in Dorado, We didn't stay on the hotel much, but to sleep and we slept sound, shower was a little awkward, but worked out great. I would definitely going back for the buck, because honestly if you go on vacation as young as we are I would rather spend the time enjoying the island. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE IF YOU'RE IN FOR A FAMILY WITH INFANTS VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: ldtc2
Reviews.Content: If you like semen stained, ripped sheets, a cheap 1950's wooden door that barely locked, and pubic hairs on the soap that were left there by the previous occupants - feel free to consider this hotel . We did not book this hotel. We were bumped by American Eagle who put us into this hotel. We got there about 1 AM, slept with our clothes on, and a chair under the door handle, and promptly left at 6:30 AM We preferred to walk aimlessly about San Juan until our flight out that night - with carry-on's in tow rather than be subjected to such a horrific experience. After we got home, and I looked up the hotel, I laughed when I saw pictures online of what they consider to be a "hotel." This place is for a 17 year old backpacker- or people on an extremely tight budget. Maybe they gave us the worst room as American Airlines had to pay for the room, but the wires that came from the hall into the room to hook up every electrical item was mind boggling. We have never ever seen such hook- ups. Do yourself a favor and don't bother even considering the place . They have nothing to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Too scary and icky to even take photos of before refusing to sleep there”
Reviews.Author: bebops87018
Reviews.Content: For the record, we did not make reservations at this hotel. We were sent to to it by the Oceana Hostal Playero who overbooked and had no room for us despite our reservation. So we headed there- arriving to a front desk that has boxes with wires sticking out and looks like an electrical hazard- and are walked up through this deserted feeling building and shown to a room. We were at a loss for words. The guy who brought us to our room was very nice but he left and we just looked around and didn't know what to think. The room ($90) had no window to speak of, a rickety little table with a Coleman water cooler on it, and a dirty looking bed. That's it. Dim, nothing pretty about it or even slightly appealing. The walls were peeling, there was a little concrete step up to the "bathroom" which had a wet floor around the toilet. The pillowcase and sheets were stained. I called the Oceana and told them we absolutely would not stay there and ended up calling and going to the Hampton Inn in Isla Verde (twice the price and worh every penny after this experience). I have no idea about the reviewers who were happy here- maybe there are better rooms there that we were not offered? I would never, ever recommend this place to anyone. Pay a little more and stay somewhere else. The only thing the Hotel Iberia had going for it was a friendly front desk person. I wish I had taken photos but I was too horrified and we are not the pickiest people that expect fancy accommodations- budget is fine, but this was squalor.

Reviews.Title: “Use caution”
Reviews.Author: sunlovingjen
Reviews.Content: Not absolutely horrible but definitely not great! We got moved to this hotel when another hotel (Tres Palmas Inn) was unable to provide us with a room because it was rain-damaged. We arrived at Iberia where we were told that the electricity had been out most of the day but occasionally coming on. Power was out in the neighborhood so this was not the hotel's fault but this was a very dark place to stay without power. On a good note, Christopher Columbus at the front desk was nice and helpful in providing information. When we got up in the morning and were ready to take a shower we discovered that the shower did not work. Only one faucet on the small sink worked and I was forced to wash my long hair and get cleaned up with only this tiny sink with one faucet which was not fun! The price for the room was actually higher than the price at Tres Palmas for a room not nearly as nice. What bothered me most is that despite the problems here, no electricity, no shower, etc. no refund (partial or otherwise) or attempt to right anything was offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was very relaxing and enjoyed alot.”
Reviews.Author: relojviejo
Reviews.Content: I found that the staff was very friendly and helpful. The Manager, Chistopher was very informed about the area, and gave me some very nice places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked three nights at this hotel, but after one, had to cancel, and the "nice" hotel manager would only refund one of the two nights I didn't use. It was dirty: wet towel around the toilet, sink scum, and even burn marks on the water pitcher. For $110 (!) a night, you can do much better!

Reviews.Title: “Bad even though I did not stay there”
Reviews.Author: disgustada
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my reservation at the Hotel Iberia in San Juan, PR, immediately after reading about it on your site. Was really glad that I had done so when friends who stayed there confirmed that it was a dive. When I got home from my trip, I found that "Cristobal", the manager, still had tried to stick me with a bill for two nights because he had not known of the cancellation. When I told him that I had spoken personally with him when I cancelled, he hung up on me. So, I had to cancel my creditcard to avoid further abuse.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even think About It !”
Reviews.Author: TAINE
Reviews.Content: I had to overnight in San Juan on Jan 20 and didn't know that on Jan 19-22 San Juan celebrates a big "fiesta" named "la feria de la calle de San Sebastian". All the hotels were solid booked and the hotel Mgr who helped me found one room left at this Iberia Hotel.The outside looks pretty attractive with his spanish "casa" style and its little garden. The only room left was a 2 queen bedroom and the Manager (from Spain)priced it $132 because it was supposed to fit 4 people...Since my only other option to sleep in San Juan that night was the airport lounge...I paid and could see that the credit card receipt was untitled " garden supplies " ! So first thought = there is something strange about this hotel !! Room 307 has indeed 2 queen beds but of a terrible quality and then I found that there was no phone next to the phone directory !! + no shower head in the shower meaning that you cannot use it (great way to save water !) + no soap, no shampoo, no tooth cups, no washclothes...I could find one maid who brought 2 tiny soap bars and 2 plastic cups but that was it..The most unbeleivable is that there are metallic shades and a piece of vinyl as a window meaning that you are like sleeping outside and you get all the noise from the street, the parking lot and the building near the hotel. Of course I could not sleep more than a few hours and when I made my comments to the Mgr the next morning, he said that there were 150 guests in the hotel and that I was the only one to be complaining ...that to get a shower, we just need "water and soap" (his words !) + the phone line was down but no big deal etc...etc...I requested a partial refund but he said that even if I would have left the hotel the night before, he would have charged me because cancellation must be made 48hrs in advance !!!! Well, I don't think that I need to add anything to make the readers understand that you should NEVER pick up this hotel in San Juan even in the worse situations ! I would have accepted some conditions if I would have paid $50 but for $132 I felt totally exploited. So my recommendation is to stay away from this hotel and hopefully the Manager could know about all those bad feedbacks found in Tripadvisor. ODILE

Reviews.Title: “Your reviews were right! This place is NOT worth the gamble.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from San Juan Puerto Rico. My stay in San Juan was from Wednesday, March 24 through Monday, March 28, 2005. I stayed the first three nights at: Hotel Iberia I arrived at Hotel Iberia, on Wednesday, March 23rd at about 1:30 pm. I was shown to my room #206 by Israel. Later that day at about 3:30 pm I discovered that room #206 shower was only a â€œtrickleâ€� of water. There wasnâ€™t enough water to shower. I contacted Israel and he came to the room #206 to inspect and observe the trickle of water coming out of the showerhead. I requested a room change. Israel said all rooms were occupied. I requested any means of showering possible. He said he didnâ€™t have any alternatives. I requested to speak to the manager/ owner. He said there wasnâ€™t any way of contacting him. He said Christopher the manager / owner will be here tomorrow (Thursday) and I could speak to him tomorrow evening. Israel also stated that tomorrow morning he would look into a room change. The next morning (Thursday, March 24th) at approximately 11:00 am I moved from room #206 to room #204. Room #204 shower barely had an adequate water pressure to shower. Late that evening at about 7:00 pm I spoke to Christopher the manager/owner of Hotel Iberia. (Israel had already made Christopher aware that I wanted to speak to him and the nature of the appointment to speak to him). I requested Christopher credit my account $80.00 for the first night because there wasnâ€™t adequate water pressure to bathe. He said no credit would be issued and that he was aware of the nature of each room. Evidently Israel was also aware of the nature of room #206 shower not having enough shower water pressure to bathe. Israel and Christopher deliberately rented out room #206 that does not have adequate water pressure to shower. This place is NOT worth the gamble!

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel---great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a small, budget hotel, Hotel Iberia is certainly adequate. My room was very small and basic, but for $75 a night, it was worth it. The room and hotel was kept clean. The person at the front desk was helpful in recommending restaurants and was very willing to call a cab. The location is great--easy walking distance to the beaches, restaurants, and bars of Condado, and not far from Ocean Park, Isla Verde, and Santurce. It's a relatively short distance by cab to Old San Juan (it cost $10-$12).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This weekend we reserved a room at this hotel for March 20th because we had a very important wedding to attend, our son's! We made the reservation by phone and considered ourselves very fortunate because of the long weekend involved. Our home is 3 hours away from the San Juan area so we were looking forward to our stay in the Condado area. You can imagine our outrage and disbelief when upon arriving we found that the hotel had rented our room to someone else! when I made the reservation, I indicated that I would be at my son's wedding in Isla Verde and that we would check in in the evening. Not only were the employees indifferent to our predicament, but they did not offer any consolation or solution to our situation. I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone. They obviously do not honor reservations nor do they care what happens to guests who have counted on fair practices. My weekend was ruined. Do not reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Voudre
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. Booked 3 nights but stayed only 2 b/c I could only cancel & get a full refund for 1 night- and for that I had to endure the arrogance & mysoginism of the front desk Mgr. The lame& un-helpful clerk for the 2 nights completed the experience. Early that night the elec. went out-there were no flashlights to pass around& the only response from the clerk was a blank,don't care stare. This is a subpar place that misrepresents itself as a "hotel". Their exterior& small reception area is charming very Old World Spanish-this MUST be their bait. The Mgr pointed out that their customers are mostly traveling students-ie, the strapped for cash w/ no hostels nearby crowd. Room was dark w/very worn furniture,had an acrid smell that would not go away even though I left the pane windows open w/the a/c running, vynil shower curtains were coated w/soap scum, & a tiny awkward bathroom u had to step up to to get into (per Mgr all bathrooms were like this). It had an armoire instead of a closet & b/c of the lack of space TV was propped on a ceiling corner. I asked to see a larger room-it was worse- w/ the bedspreads threadbare.There is no elevator. It was $79 per night & this was NOT a good value as there ARE much better places for that price range-for example, the EL PRADO INN- so please check around. Anything good?: the maid kept the room dustfree.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a place to stay when our plane when our flight was cancelled. We found the owner to be extremely polite and helpful. The room was small but the decor was fablous. We stood on the rooftop cafe into the early morning listening to the sounds of Puerto Rico. The hotel is very well maintained with a beautiful garden outdoors. I highly recommed this hotel for those who like to travel off the beaten path.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Iberia
HotelInfo.Address: 1464 Wilson Street, San Juan, Puerto Rico
